{{Infobox software | name = Voiceroid | logo = | screenshot = VoiceroidZunkoscreen.jpg | screenshot size = 200px | caption = Voiceroid+ interface with Tohoku Zunko loaded | author = | developer = AH-Software | released = {{Start date and age|2009|12|04}} | latest release version = Voiceroid2 | latest release date = | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | programming language = | operating system = Windows XP/Vista/7/8 | platform = | language = Japanese | status = Active | genre = Speech Synthesizer Application | license = Proprietary | website = }}
'''Voiceroid''' is a speech synthesizer application developed by [[AH Software]] and is designed for speech. It is only available in the [[Japanese language]]. Its name comes from the singing software [[Vocaloid]], for which [[AH-Software]] also develops voicebanks. Both AH-Software's Vocaloids and Voiceroids went on sale on December 4, 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vocaloidism.com/2009/11/14/new-voiceroid-software-from-ah-software/|title=New VOICEROID Software From AH-Software|publisher=Vocaloidism|date=November 14, 2009|accessdate=July 9, 2010}}</ref>
It differs from regular [[Speech synthesis|Text to Speech]] programs in that it gives the user more control over settings like [[tempo]], [[Pitch (music)|pitch]], and [[Intonation (music)|intonation]].
==Overview== Voiceroid uses an engine called ''AITalk'' developed by AI Inc. The user is able to adjust the [[tempo]], [[Pitch (music)|pitch]], and [[Intonation (music)|intonation]] to make the program sound more natural. The original two products Tsukuyomi Shouta and Tsukuyomi Ai were packaged with the animating software, Crazy Talk SE.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.gigazine.net/index.php?/news/comments/20091113_voiceroid/|title=VOICEROID "Tsukuyomi Ai" and "Tsukuyomi Shouta" will Read Out Your Favourite Line in Moe Voices|publisher=|accessdate=26 April 2016|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120707190745/http://en.gigazine.net/index.php?/news/comments/20091113_voiceroid/|archive-date=7 July 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
On October 22, 2010, a new version of the engine was introduced known as, ''Voiceroid+''. The first of this new engine featured a character from the children's anime ''[[Eagle Talon (anime)|Eagle Talon]]'', known as Yoshida-kun. Much like Shouta & Ai, he is aimed at young audiences.
The first three Voiceroids were targeted at younger audiences, so they were subject to censorship, and inappropriate words were filtered out. However, Maki Tsurumaki was designed specifically for a more older audience and is the first of the series to have no form of censorship.<ref>[http://vocaloid-creativity.totalh.com/index.php/vocaloid-news/47-new-voiceroid-is-new Vocaloid news article]</ref> Yuzuki Yukari is also the first Vocaloid to have a Voiceroid voicebank as well as a [[Vocaloid]] voicebank. For Tohoku Zunko's release the software has been vastly improved compared to previous Voiceroid+ voices.The first two Voiceroids to come in one package are Kotonoha Akane・Aoi. In 2015, the software was upgraded to ''Voiceroid+ ex''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ah-soft.com/voiceroid/|title=AH-Software - VOICEROIDシリーズ|publisher=|accessdate=27 April 2016}}</ref>
In 2017, the newest version of the software "Voiceroid 2" was announced. This version has a number of new features and differences, though can still import the past Voiceroid and its variants into it. However, older engine versions will not be able to use any new features.
==Products== [[File:Makivoiceroid.jpg|thumb|right|Boxart for Voiceroid+; Maki]]
===Voiceroid=== '''Voiceroid''' *'''Tsukuyomi Shouta''': Was designed to be based on a seven-year-old male. Release date: December 4, 2009 *'''Tsukuyomi Ai''': Was designed to be a five-year-old female and Shouta's "sister" product. Release date: December 4, 2009
'''Voiceroid+''' *'''Yoshida-Kun''':<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ah-soft.com/press/voiceroid/0930.html|title=VOICEROID+ 鷹の爪 吉田くん - 入力文字読み上げソフト|publisher=|accessdate=26 April 2016}}</ref> Was based on the character of the same name from the anime ''[[Eagle Talon (anime)|Eagle Talon]]''. Release date: October 22, 2010. *'''Maki''':<ref>{{cite web|url=http://vocaloid.blog120.fc2.com/blog-date-20101022.html|title=初音ミクみく|publisher=|accessdate=26 April 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ah-soft.com/voiceroid/maki/|title=VOICEROID+ 民安ともえ EX|publisher=|accessdate=26 April 2016}}</ref> A teenage female. Release date: November 12, 2010. She is the first Voiceroid to not contain censorship of curse words. *'''[[Yuzuki Yukari]]''': The first [[Vocaloid 3#Yuzuki Yukari|Vocaloid]] to also have a Voiceroid library. She has several new expressions. Release date: December 22, 2011 *'''[[Tohoku Zunko]]''': A teenage female. She was originally created to help promote the recovery of the [[Tohoku]] region. Her character design is based on a zundamochi, a Tohoku specialty.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vocaloidism.com/tohoku-zunko-voiceroid-software-gets-release-date/|title=Tohoku Zunko VOICEROID+ Software Gets Release Date|publisher=Vocaloidism|date=August 30, 2012|accessdate=September 6, 2012}}</ref> Release date: September 28, 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vocaloidism.com/tohoku-zunko-voiceroid-software-gets-release-date/|title=Tohoku Zunko VOICEROID+ Software Gets Release Date|work=Vocaloidism|accessdate=26 April 2016}}</ref> She received a [[Vocaloid 3#Tohoku Zunko|Vocaloid 3]] voicebank in June 2014. *'''Kotonoha Akane・Aoi''': A pair of twin sisters. They are voiced by [[Sakakibara Yui]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dtmstation.com/archives/51891655.html|title=関西弁、標準語を使い分ける音声合成ソフト、琴葉茜・葵が登場！|work=藤本健の“DTMステーション”|accessdate=26 April 2016}}</ref>
'''Voiceroid + Ex''' *All 6 past voiceroids except the Kotonoha package were upgraded. *'''Minase Kou''':<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ah-soft.com/voiceroid/kou/|title=VOICEROID+ 水奈瀬コウ EX|publisher=|accessdate=26 April 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dtmstation.com/archives/51959145.html|title=男モノの使える音源、VOCALOID、VOICEROIDが揃って誕生|work=藤本健の“DTMステーション”|accessdate=26 April 2016}}</ref> is the first new male vocal released for this version of the software. He was released on October 29, 2015. *'''Tohoku Kiritan''': Kiritan is currently undergoing a campaign to become a Voiceroid. She is one of two sisters of [[Vocaloid3]] vocal "[[Tohoku Zunko]]" and currently has a [[UTAU]] vocal released for her. The goal for her to become a Voiceroid was pitched at ¥4,500,000 to be raised by 18 May 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://greenfunding.jp/pub/projects/1459|title=東北きりたん（CV：茜屋日海夏）に声をください！ボイスロイド化プロジェクト|work=GREEN FUNDING|accessdate=26 April 2016}}</ref> At time of closing she raised ¥6,983,080, 55% more than was require for her to become a Voiceroid. She was released on October 27, 2016.
===Voiceroid 2=== *'''Yuzuki Yukari''': *'''Kotonoha Akane・Aoi''':<ref>https://twitter.com/ahsoft/status/856707342829625345?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw&ref_url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.vocaloidotaku.net%2Findex.php%3F%2Ftopic%2F69808-voiceroid2-yuzuki-yukari-kotonoha-aoiakane%2</ref> *'''Tohoku Itako''': confirmation of her production began after yet another successful crowd fund which raised ¥10,300,000 upon closing. She is the eldest sister of Tohoku Zunko and Tohoku Kiritan. <ref>http://nlab.itmedia.co.jp/nl/articles/1711/14/news087.html</ref> *'''Kizuna Akari''': Confirmed for the software, she is a 15 year old female Japanese vocal. Release date is December 22, 2017<ref>http://www.ah-soft.com/voiceroid/akari/</ref> *'''Haruno Sora''': was released on July 26, 2018 with both Vocaloid and Voiceroid vocals. Sora is a 17 year old female. <ref>https://www.ah-soft.com/voiceroid/sora/</ref>
